documents.document: @NomadicT_JonoVP It's all that travelling that keeps you looking so young....and Thursday night football, of course.
@NomadicT_JonoVP Congrats, you don't look a day over 29!
@guardian_sport @JonnyOwenFilm Looks like an absolute cracker. Maybe it's time to own up to being slightly Welsh.
@Masters_JamesD It is sad when you begin to lose any genuine sense of affinity. But in football things can turn around quickly.
@Masters_JamesD Ha, it's weird that as I grow older the more my club affects me & my mood.
@Masters_JamesD @SportSJA Congratulations James. Let's face it as an Orient fan you deserve some good news.
@OneBallForGazza @FootballCliches There has to be a campaign in getting black & white striped posts introduced into English football.
@MartinBelam I used to work for a magazine called Checkout Fresh & contrary to popular belief it was about fruit & veg.
@mattwilson_star So why did the club hush this up?
@thesefootytimes @alexclapham Excellent dissection of how the heart and soul has been ripped out of football. Read and weep.
@JonnyOwenFilm @pkelso @owen_g Just the Manics then.
Is Max Boyce involved @JonnyOwenFilm? https://t.co/qM1yGenGfT
@jamesjamesbrown @Tristram_Foster Excellent, we both look forward to reading it. At least Palace are known for decent kits if not teams!
@NickQuantrill @Crap90sFootball @VineCreators Wow and one for @HillyTheFish to enjoy.
@mrjakehumphrey @colinadams83 @BobRutler @PercyVarco Exactly & if you want to know how bad it can be look at this - https://t.co/YvtguRTO7r
@johnnydobbo Dead right the epitome of avuncular charm.
@johnnydobbo @GeoffLemonSport Brilliant diatribe by Coney who just can't help himself & then wanders off like a lost soul.
@JonBloggs66 @Adamvirgs19 Just feel momentum is so important & underrated. Wins breed confidence whilst losses do the very opposite.
Here's a shot of @Tristram_Foster getting ready for football tonight with his bible @jamesjamesbrown https://t.co/4asSy82ASv
@IanWaghorn @bluedotfestival @PIXIES @alt_J @orbitalband I have taken her before but she seems to think Rome is more attractive option.
@IanWaghorn @bluedotfestival @PIXIES @alt_J @orbitalband You're right, my fave band. Thanks but slight clash with 25th wedding anniversary😍
Good to hear @jamesjamesbrown on @bbc5live talking about 5-a-side, am lucky enough to have advance copy of Above Head Height & it's great.
@bpfootball And for some background on what happens when players are facing long period out injured - https://t.co/Mm4PY6PDfE
@BenDinnery So that now makes around 9 ACLs in Premier League does it not?
@_umara @KopLeft It's clear that if you fall out with Klopp it's tough to win him back over. Looking forward to seeing him at Selhurst.
@AlanBiggs1 @sportingsheff Like all great players/ journalists you always do the first week in your head, Alan!
@_umara @KopLeft Interesting, so do you think he will be a positive influence at Palace? Clearly talented but possibly bit wayward.
It's a pity but not a surprise that in the new era of celebrity managers the terse post-match interview has become the norm.
@A_Hess @YouTube Is this the start of a 345-part series?
@IanDarke Came up with one of my favourite sports quotes to age-old question what would you be if you weren't a footballer? A virgin.
@philcparry @BBCLondonSport Get there quickly as he might not be there that long!
@chrisgrierson @FYPFanzine We Come 1 by Faithless featuring our very own Maxi Jazz.
@BarcaJim 'Interesting...very interesting'.
@AlanBiggs1 @sportingsheff Look out for a nice range of excellent titles from @OckleyBooks oh and this one that sne… https://t.co/08d59ZmjnR
@NeilTague @WilliamBiss @legend_footy Absolutely. There were a few in Italian football.
@andytheeagle @AmazonUK Thanks for those kind words, Andy, much appreciated.
@BestFootyPieces @FootballCliches @planetfutebol Fab piece with that amazing pic of Bryan Robson & great video of Hoddle belittling Moncur.
"The Agony & the Ecstasy" back in Top 10 of Amazon's English Football League best sellers, all reviews welcome - https://t.co/cOPsuPtZsv
@Wilsonfooty And of the bottom four Sunderland & Hull creditable draws, Palace & Swansea won. Table turned upside down.
@MellorFootball *promotion, although potion also works...
@MellorFootball Your record of 4 attempts & no potion stretching all way back to 1987, the very first year of Play-Offs suggest you're right
So in midweek games 20th team drew with 3rd, 19th drew with 6th away, 18th beat 13th away & 17th beat 11th. Top 4 3 pts bottom 4 8 pts. Mad.
Gold looks like he's already wrapped up the schadenfreude of the season award. https://t.co/777h3Mp4nv
@RiseGuide @ParlourUK How dare you go to another quiz! @SeventhHeavenKR miss you come next Tuesday @InfoMasons, well ask a film question!
@DavidHartrick @scottsltr @Inbedwimaradona Good luck Scott, big boots to fill...
Love this quote from @wilfriedzaha "Wherever I am I have always got Palace at heart." Welcome back, Wilf. https://t.co/Bk9dYEW9ju
@DanielHarris @guardian @guardian_sport Missed the chance of this - Stokes avoids pokey after mocking the King.
@bglendenning @lukemcmanus Don't wish to be a pedant but it's 1st Feb.
@domfifield @samuelpjordan ...before the storm. First time have had positive vibes about club for long time & Bournemouth result helped.
@brucemillington @simoncaney Totally agree apart from the fact that Wilf is no longer an England player, more's the pity.
@DannyLast @DavidHartrick @OckleyBooks Quick question Dan is it because of my affiliation to that club that you don't follow me on Twitter?
@LeeStTaylor Thanks for clarifying that as I was wondering who he was aiming that at.
@DannyLast @DavidHartrick Surely the next @OckleyBooks colouring book is up for grabs?
@MatthewStanger @RobJ_Cricket @thesetpieces So he has established his Roots (Hall). One for @iainmacintosh there.
@fishplums @squires_david There's the second chapter -Matty 'Turncoat' Taylor. This book is writing itself!
@squires_david @fishplums That's the first chapter sorted - Joey 'Judas' Beauchamp.
@squires_david @fishplums Has there been a book that charts players who have jumped ship to deadly rivals? If not, it's my next project.
@tonyhodson1 @mike_anstead @Jsamahood @Tommyophoto @SportMagUK @vardy7 Great pic & apt cover star who shone briefly but has struggled since.
@devonangells I think we should allow it to happen a handful of times over next few months.
@devonangells That was both terrifying and exhilarating at the same time. 🔴🔵😝😁
In this era of 'fake news' just wanted to check that Palace did win, kept a clean sheet and scored a late goal rather than conceding. #cpfc
Sigurdsson is class, if only we had got him a few seasons ago.
@FootballFact101 @ShowDugout @armandjerome9 @JasonRoberts30 Because Hazard had gone off.
Bloody hell looks like we aren't going to be on @BBCMOTD after all. It will be February before we're on. #cpfc
@CPFCMitch_ Worth 2 red cards, Dembele was lucky he wasn't badly hurt.
@CPFCMitch_ Mind you that Rodwell tackle was pretty special. 😝
@HLTCO @Tommy_CPFC_2010 @CpfcNews_ Who was he winding up?
@kevinhunterday Not drinking but rather enjoying this abstemious life today.
Can we just call our new Serbian player Milli Vanilli? Thanks again. #cpfc
@J__Best @HLTCO And look at @wilfriedzaha. Welcome back, Wilf, we missed you.
@theinsidelefty @SportMagUK Fitting epitaph.
@eaamalyon Very good question & one I have often asked myself. It's all TexMex chains.
Did you think up mango Mussolini? Absolutely brilliant & immediately goes to top of my favourite nicknames. https://t.co/ATX1eTESwa
Received this little beauty by @jamesjamesbrown today, thanks to @QuercusBooks. Can't wait to get 'stuck in.' https://t.co/sgbmJdZqCw
@d_gray_writer Going to give it to my son @Tristram_Foster who like many 15 year-old boys is a reluctant reader & am sure he'll love it.
@sportingintel At least Palace are near top of one table!
Just finished Saturday, 3pm. A simply wonderful, warm, beautiful elegy to football. Too many highlights to name. Thanks @d_gray_writer.
@Walshey2010 @grubhinho @chrisgrierson @CPFC @TheBudgieTweets 'Doris' Hinshelwood for the most appropriate nickname ever.
@Walshey2010 @grubhinho @chrisgrierson @CPFC @TheBudgieTweets But Budgie more of a cult hero because of his antics eg handstands etc.
@pnm1979 Bit early to say but feels as though a corner is being turned. Long way to go but more encouraging.
@Walshey2010 @grubhinho @chrisgrierson @CPFC Plenty of candidates. Starting with the keeper, has to be @TheBudgieTweets for many reasons.
@grubhinho @Walshey2010 Did you see the Cult Heroes piece on him by @chrisgrierson on @CPFC? Was rather good.
@ecfc32 @thesackrace I know but I was referring to just FL Play-Offs.
@ed_aarons The holy trinity.
@Bonn1eGreer @Bhoysagoodin @tommacjones Just making sure credit where credit's due.
@Walshey2010 @grubhinho The new Sasa Curcic, hopefully without the ridiculous hairdo / beard.
@Bonn1eGreer @Bhoysagoodin @tommacjones That is a copy of one used in the States previously.
@thehistoryguy @ATW1062 Classic Tit for Tat.
May Trump be silenced forever.
@FACupFactfile @jennythegiraffe Thank you that clarifies things. Would not a lion have worked or a leopard?
@FACupFactfile @jennythegiraffe I would do but doesn't seem to be very active on Twitter. Maybe she's above all that. Boom Tish.
@SeventhHeavenKR @InfoMasons @slondonuk If you think they look intellectually intimidating then try compering them. Absolute rabble.
Can somebody enlighten me as to why Sutton have a giraffe as their mascot?
@FootballCliches Bold colour scheme - yellow & brown. Wear it with pride.
@BenDudley010 @JoeLedleysBeard @FAWales @arogeraldes @bizarrepicks @CuriosFutbol @AfricaSphera @sportingafrica This is turning into a craze!
@julianchenery I think Rudd has had a wee operation.
Disappointing that Crystal Palace was the answer on @UniversityChal but was to do with venue of FA Cup Finals & also Seagull got it right.
@ed_aarons So who was that chap who won the Euros with Portugal then, David?
@stighefootball @Crazysandra101 If this isn't parody then her maths are not that hot as it's tricky to fit 20 teams into Q/Fs.
@GraemeBailey Playing hard ball is not going to work.
